column4: in that regard, Debian and Ubuntu tend to share quite similar attitudes, although we're a bit more flexible than Debian in some ways
Really?  How so?
Ubuntu is officially not bothered about the GFDL, for instance
GFDL?
too long to explain
Gnu Free Distributed License?  O.o
try google ;)
Doing so now. :)
Interesting.  I thought Debian was a part of GNU.
not for many years
Wow, I'm out of touch.  :)
Thank you Kamion, I believe you have instantly made several people much happier.  :)
very controversial
Have they been known to retract their policy when they make bad decisions?  Or will they stick with the advice of their "legal team" do you think?
mm, not that simple really; decisions can be retracted, but there *are* real problems with the licence so it's complicated
Ah, but it *seems* simple.
I looked at their short little quips which give me the same gist as do the GNU licenses, except in three lines.
I mean it's not that simple as 'retract, or stick with the advice of their "legal team"'
Ah, I see.
In that there will be those in favor and those opposed to the decision?
yes, it's controversial within the project; but off-topic here really
my apologies.  I'll keep quiet about it.  :)
it would probably fit better in a Debian channel, that's all. :)
well, I just like talking about things with people who I know (or have been acquainted with for more than a few seconds)
